episodes.title: Geneva on Suicide & Religious Abuse #leavingthenetwork #mentalhealthmatters #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
Geneva was a member of High Rock Church in Bloomington, IN, under pastor Scott Joseph when she was in college. She discussed the tactful recruitment strategies used like love bombing. Then she moved with the plant team for Joshua Church in Austin, TX, under pastor & Network President Steve Morgan, where, among other things, Steve said, "Leaving is shipwrecking your faith". (Total time in The Network 2013-2022.)

Geneva takes you through her mental health journey, demonstrating enormous courage and generosity in sharing her truth to help prevent others from falling prey to a Network church. Her metaphorical use of a glowstick for her experiences is quite moving "8-12 hours of light when you break it, slowly dimming to a lightless piece of plastic". 

She shares with us from journals she kept in a Network church where she organized her thoughts. She would later learn that the stories we recover are rarely linear because trauma fragments our memories, so keeping journals helped her understand what really happened to her. 

Geneva talks about her biggest stumbling block, which is developing a sense of self and having a decent self-concept, and how she's put a lot of work and resources into surviving this. 

When the LTN Reddit group started, Geneva said she was one of the first ones there to share her name, not using an anonymous handle. The reason why this matters is how her former pastor Scott Joseph called the people on this site "a toxic cesspool of leeches" (audio on LeavingTheNetwork.org ) and this really hurt her as he knew exactly who he was speaking about. She advises people to read Ezekiel 34 - where God offers care to those who were hurt by the failings of shepherds & those in authority positions. 

She finishes by discussing how they taught her to "obey your leader in all things big and small even if he's wrong" (audio on LTN) and how ultimately she had to leave after trying to get pastors to help her and treat her well for years. She shared her email with them & their response was undeniably vacant of all care and concern. They said "We have a clear conscience" in response to her discussion of suicide.

episodes.title: Lori on Network Church Dividing the Family  #leavingthenetwork #religioustrauma #familymatters
episodes.description:
Lori's family joined Foundation Church (formerly called Clear View) in Normal, IL 2010 under pastor Jeff Miller. After Jeff left The Network due to disagreement with Steve Morgan's leadership, Justin Major became the lead pastor. It was the beginning of the end for Lori as she had realized this church system didn't have what she needed & Justin's leadership was extremely controlling and limiting her growth. She was told by Justin to stop speaking to young women because he didn't want "triangulation" and wanted all guidance coming from their small group leaders or him. 

Lori and her husband left in 2015, but her son (in his 20's) remained there. Around this time Lori had 1 conversation with her son about why Jeff left the Network leadership. Her son was completely unaware of the deep problems with the Network and she felt his resistance to this topic of conversation so she chose family peace over pushing this any further. She left and the family maintained regular contact for 5 years. 

Then 1 year & 3 months ago out of the blue in 2023, her son cut them off via a text. He has not responded to any attempts to discuss what went wrong. Lori contends this act was influenced by Justin Major. Justin had cut his own family off, he was groomed at 19yrs. old to go into leadership and never had any seminary or theological training...like nearly all Network pastors including the Network Leadership Board who oversee them (Steve Morgan, Sandor Paull, Tony Ranvestal, Luke Williams, and James Chidester.) 

"Never been in a church that has openly is ok with families being cut off because they dive into these young kids' business, they get them to confess their issues, and then they use them against the family. There is no biblical precedence for this. How is this ok biblically to cut people off without ever having a conversation or a chance for repentance or reconciliation. The sole purpose is to divide relationships." 

Sadly this story is all too familiar across The Network churches led by Steven D. Morgan. Parents, siblings, entire families, and friends get a text or message saying "I need time to take a break, get space and think about our relationship". Then they cut all ties. In similar stories, there is often a "let's FaceTime or I'd like to resolve our issues request".

She believes there is an (evil) entity at work here and it's to seek and destroy the family. 
Lori's story is also published in written format on LeavingTheNetwork.org
